(Officer's individual report--under paragraph 806, A. R., 1895. To be forwarded through intermediate commanders.)

Individual Service Report of Walter Reed, Surgeon, U.S.A. for
the period from June 30, 1899, to June 30, 1900:
Station Camp Columbia, Cuba.
Date June 30th 1900.

TO THE ADJUTANT GENERAL, U. S. ARMY,
Washington, D.C.
SIR: I have the honor to report that during the period between June 30, 1899, and June 30, 1900:

1. I was present for duty with my regiment or corps 11 months, --- days,
and present sick --- months, --- days.
(a) On detached service One (1) months, --- days.
(b) On ordinary leave --- months, --- days.
(c) Absent on sick leave --- months, --- days.

2. Married or single Married Number of minor children one (1)
Outside of the routine duties of my position, I have studied or pursued a course of reading--
3. In the line of the military profession ---

4. Professional or scientific study and investigation other than military. If graduated from any
college or school other than U. S. Military Academy, so state, U. of Va. M. D. 1869,
Bellvue Hosp. Medical College, N. Y. M.O. 1872.

5. Foreign languages studied French, German, Italian.
(a) Able to speak Italian moderately well.
(b) Able to translate French, German, Italian, Spanish.
(c) Special knowledge of any particular line of work, whatever its nature
Pathology & Bacteriology.
6. Business experience, nature and extent of None.

7. Subjects or titles of books written or published, essays prepared, lectures delivered or papers
read, when and where- “A comparison of the biological characters
of, pathological lesions produces by Bacillus ec (Sternberg)
bacillus icteroides (Sanarelli) and the hog-cholera
bacillus (Salmon & Smith) journal of experimental medicine,
July 1900.
Remarks:-----

8. On reverse side of this sheet give a succinct account of services since June 30, 1899, with dates
of battles, actions, etc., in which engaged. If in prior reports this was not stated, give the information
here. In the case of officers of Volunteers a full statement of service from entry into service or from
May, 1898, should be given.
I CERTIFY that the entries herein made are true to the best of my knowledge and belief.

Walter Reed,
Major Surg. U.S.A.
NOTE.--Under “Remarks” give any necessary explanation of any answer for which the allotted space is insufficient.
